comment: Guys. Please do not take her. She is extremely mean to students who have a hard time with comprehension.

There is a good bit of work but it is very engaging and laid out in away that makes it easy to plan. She only takes off a portion of a grade for every day that work is late, I had 2-3 things I turned in 3-4 days and still got an A. I also did an honors project for the course that was 12-pages long and she was very helpful! I would recommend her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: I would avoid taking her if you can. Its honestly not that bad but the workload is honestly ridiculous. You have a bunch of readings and videos to cover before class and then only quizzed on like 3 of the 20 articles so you feel like you wasted time. Shes very boring and not engaging but wants the class to be so we just sit in silence. She

Harsh grader, crazy workload every week. 15 quizzes, video check in every tues, long discussion post due on Thursdays with a response. Including 2 papers that's 1500 words or more. I will not take this class again.

Excessive amounts of work. This semester we have to do 3 oral interviews each 20 minutes long, 3 primary source essays, an online presentation, discussion post EVERY Thursday (4-6 questions long about the assigned readings), video response of yourself EVERY Tuesday and a final paper. The only thing I will say is that she is lenient with late work.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: An abundant amount of work, very tedious, and a harsh grader. If you want an A, I recommend you go over the top to complete the work. Can be overwhelming at times as projects she assigns tend to be due back to back.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Do not, I repeat, DO NOT select Professor Hill for this course. The workload and reading load is insanely ridiculous and her grading is just as harsh. Every time one of her assignments is due (which is at least 3 times a week) I stress out so much because of how rigidly she grades. Save yourself the trouble.

AMST1102 IS NOT AN EASY A. Kind of difficult professor in my opinion. Discussion post due Mondays, peer replies due Tuesdays, major discussion question on Thursdays. Grading is strict. Biggest assignment is the 3000 word Generations paper and timeline. Not that easy of a course, not to mention she barely replies to emails. Avoid.

Dr. Hill is one of the brightest profs at KSU. If your arguments lack primary sources or fail to engage the texts, then she will rightly point it out. On the other hand, if you can fully engage with the texts, pointing out specific claims, then your grade will soar. If you're curious about American Studies, take her class!

She's a very difficult person to deal with. She's quick on criticism, which often turns personal, and short on constructive advice. Her assignment guidance is minimal and vague, but she's quick with negative feedback for not following directions. If I had to take her again to graduate, I would just quit the program. She's that bad.

Dr. Hill is the most insightful, supportive and generous mentor I could have wished for. She is incredibly knowledgeable, intelligent, and interesting. She cares about her students, while challenging them to think harder and more deeply. I was lucky to have a chance to learn from her classes during my time at KSU. A truly great professor!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: This is a academic methodology class. It was a whole new learning experience, since I'd never had a vigorous methods class in undergrad. What makes Dr. HIll a great professor is she is very accessible and open to sitting down & talking 1-on1. She was infinitely patient with me & my many questions and concerns.

I was enrolled in another grad program when I enrolled in this class as an elective. Ultimately, I ended up switching my graduate degree program to American Studies because of this class I took with Dr. HIll. I appreciate her approach, which is scholarly and grounded in theory. She has high standards, which any academic appreciates! Recommend

Dr. Hill is a very difficult professor to take and doesn't grade too fairly if you don't have the same political beliefs as her. It's very hard to receive a good grade and express your opinions in a paper if you know you are going to do poorly when she returns it.

Dr. Hill grades arbitrarily, gives feedback that ranges from passive-aggressive to vicious, and offers absolutely no guidance on assignments whatsoever. She has high expectations, but she doesn't do her part. She is the hardest professor you will ever take, and she doesn't care what happens to you or what you think. Enroll at your own risk.
